Mr Michael Gove stressed the decision to protect music funding when there were pressures on budgets elsewhere showed the Michael Government was committed to music in schools. He said: Music has the power to touch the soul. It is a universal language understood by people of every culture. And it gives us all the chance to be transported by beauty. "But access to the best musical education is not universal and the opportunity to benefit from great instrumental tuition is not shared equally. ` Positive change' Mr Michael Gove also announced plans for scheme to get more music professionals teaching in schools.
